### Tjostheim's Coefficient

We calculated the pairwise correlation of completeness and NNI vs population density, road density, number of plots in Nature 2000 using Tjostheim's Coefficient. The implemented technique is a nonparametric coefficient that summarizes the association between two spatial variables.

```{r}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)

Names <- c("Comp_Dist", "Comp_Nat", "Comp_Pop", "Comp_Rough", "NNI_Dist", "NNI_Nat", "NNI_Pop", "NNI_Rough")
Cor <- c(0.0155, 0.0500, 0.0358, -0.0082, -0.0259, -0.0316, -0.0216, -0.0156)
df <- data.frame(cbind(Names, Cor))
df
```

## Temporal Bias

We calculated the temporal bias as Pielou's evenness. J's Index is computed per grid considering the year of each plot observation.

<center>![Pielou\'s evenness](E:/Dottorato2/sPlot/Pielou.jpg){height="300px"}</center>

<center>![Temporal bias (J) per country](E:/Dottorato2/sPlot/TB_even_box.jpg){height="300px"}</center>

## Temporal uncertainty

We calculated the exponential decay of plot information assiging 3 exponetial values (z=-1, z=-1/5, z=-1/25). Besides, the temporal precision per grid was computed as median and weighted mean of the plots' values resulting from the exponential curve.

<center>![Curves of exponential decay of plots information](E:/Dottorato2/sPlot/curveTU_F.jpg){height="300px"}</center>

<center>![Temporal precision calculated as median value](E:/Dottorato2/sPlot/medianTU.jpg){height="300px"}</center>

<center>![Temporal precision calculated as weighted mean value](E:/Dottorato2/sPlot/wmTU.jpg){height="300px"}</center>
